_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies

The Beaumont Chemical Plant (the plant, stationary source) has a RMP policy to assure adherence to all applicable Federal and State rules and regulations.  The plant complies with the PSM Standard 29CFR 1910.119 and thus it falls under the Program 3 of the RMP compliance.

The plant emergency response program is developed and outlined in standards, procedures and training.  The Emergency Response Plan includes procedures for notification of the local authority and notification of any potentially affected neighbors.

2. The stationary source and regulated substances handled

This chemical processing facility (plant, stationary source) produces high purity isoprene, polyisoprene rubber, polybutadiene rubber, hydrocarbon resins and rubber antioxidants.

The plant consists of the following covered processes:

1. Wing chemicals
2. Natsyn
3. Refrigeration utilities
4. Isoprene
5. General tank farm
6. Budene
7. Utilities water treatment
8. Budene 850

These processes handle, above the threshold, the following highly hazardous chemicals listed by the EPA RMP Rule:

Boron trifluoride                                       
Chlorine                                                    
Titanium tetrachloride                             
Isobutylene                                              
Isoprene                                             
Butadiene-1,3                                         
Propane                                                     
Pentane (mixture of isomers)                     

3. Chemical accident prevention

The facility complies with the PSM Standard. Hazard assessment (Process Hazard Analyses) have been conducted on the original processes, on expansion improvements as well as the new Specialty Polymers unit. They are also conducted on changes that trigger the Management of Change process. The original PHA are revalidated on a 5-years cycle. The facility and its equipment are de

signed according with the recognized good engineering practices and standards such as ANSI, API, NFPA, ISA, ASTM and other. PSM audits are conducted on a 3-years schedule. The plant has extensive redundant systems to ensure safe operation.  Operators are trained and certified to operate the plant.  They are recertified every 3 years.  The plant has made application to OSHA to be in the VPP program and are waiting on our audit.  Management has placed safety and the environment as the highest priority for operating the plant. There are safety and health coordinators assigned to each operating area with sole responsibilities for safety.  

5. Five years accident history

No process accidents happened in last 5 years that would affect any external public or environmental receptors.

6. Emergency Response Program

Tha facility has the Emergency Response team trained monthly in theory and practice of responding to emergencies. Community is informed about ongoing emergencies via the LEPC, Sheriff's department or the Southeast Texas Alert Network.
